intro: Acsmithia meridionalis, commonly known as the southern acsmithia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
